revised_title: Residual Elements and Materials Properties: Influence on Hot Shortness and High-Temperature Embrittlement
tldr: This article discusses the influence of residual and trace elements on hot shortness and high-temperature embrittlement in materials, particularly in steel. It explores the interactions between various elements and their effects on the properties of materials during hot working. The author also examines the role of molten phases in the development of hot short behavior and the impact of various oxidizing atmospheres on enrichment processes.
